column3: Hmm, this will lead to endless discussions.\n\nIt seems there are some proponents of flake8 (e.g. @jnewbery uses it to format files after an edit), so I wouldn't mind if we just did a reformat of the whole python code to normalize the coding style and then enforce it and never worry about it again.
Should I fix this again the formatting or close this and have big reformat later?
Yes, I'd prefer one large commit that changes only ignorable white space. I.e. `git diff --ignore-all-space` returns an empty string.

Not worth fixing in a separate PR in my opinion.

> I wouldn't mind if we just did a reformat of the whole python code to normalize the coding style

This would be a huge PR causing lots of rebases, so I'm not sure if it's worth it. If we do it, we should add more of the flake8 rules in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/contrib/devtools/lint-python.sh to ensure that format rul
Must remove the comma, otherwise reformatting with yapf forces a new line.
still wrong formatting in this line
